intro: Phlox amoena subsp. lighthipei, commonly known as the Lighthipei phlox, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of North America. It belongs to the Polemoniaceae family and is characterized by its showy, clustered flowers that typically bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant features upright, herbaceous stems and lance-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy texture. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for garden landscapes. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its vibrant colors, which range from pink to purple, depending on the specific variety.
